description: From international scientific vocabulary, from New Latin adipōsus, from Latin adeps (“fat, lard”); surface analysis, adip- +‎ -ose; Latin adeps (“fat, lard”) is probably related to Umbrian 𐌀𐌛𐌄𐌐𐌄𐌔 (ařepes, “offerings of fat”) since 𐌛 (ř) in Umbrian regularly represents an earlier *d.

adjectives.description: adipose (comparative more adipose, superlative most adipose)

entries.meaning: Containing, composed of, or consisting of fat; fatty.
Animal fat stored in the tissue of the body.
